pg13 1.0.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Drop a Table

Source: R/table.R
drop_table.Rd

Drop a Table

drop_table(
  conn,
  conn_fun,
  schema,
  table,
  if_exists = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE,
  render_sql = TRUE,
  render_only = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

if_exists

If TRUE, the table will be dropped only if it exists.
...

Additional arguments passed to DatabaseConnector::dbSendStatement()

Examples

library(pg13)
create_test_schema <-
        function(conn) {

                if (!schema_exists(conn = conn,
                                   schema = "test_schema")) {

                        cli::cli_rule("Create 'test_schema' Schema")

                        create_schema(conn = conn,
                                      schema = "test_schema")

                }
        }

conn <- local_connect(dbname = "pg13_test")

#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
create_test_schema(conn = conn)

#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
write_table(conn = conn,
            schema = "test_schema",
            table_name = "test_table",
            drop_existing = TRUE,
            data = data.frame(A = 1:3, B = letters[1:3]))

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Dropping...
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Sending...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Sending...complete
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Dropping...complete
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: N/A
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Writing...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Writing...complete


append_table(conn = conn,
             schema = "test_schema",
             table = "test_table",
             data = data.frame(A = 1:3, B = letters[1:3]))

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: N/A
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Appending...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Appending...complete

append_table(conn = conn,
             schema = "test_schema",
             table = "test_table",
             data = data.frame(A = 1:3, B = rep(NA_character_, 3)))

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: N/A
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Appending...
#> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Appending...complete

test_data <- read_table(conn = conn,
                           schema = "test_schema",
                           table = "test_table")

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: SELECT * FROM test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Reading...
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	SQL: SELECT * FROM test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Querying...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Querying...complete
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:19]	Reading...complete

test_data

#>   a    b
#> 1 1    a
#> 2 2    b
#> 3 3    c
#> 4 1    a
#> 5 2    b
#> 6 3    c
#> 7 1 <NA>
#> 8 2 <NA>
#> 9 3 <NA>

search_table(conn = conn,
             schema = "test_schema",
             table = "test_table",
             values = 1:3)

             values = "a")

search_table(conn = conn,
             schema = "test_schema",
             table = "test_table",
             values = c("A", "b", "C"),
             case_insensitive = FALSE)

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Listing Fields...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Listing Fields...complete
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	SQL: SELECT * FROM test_schema.test_table t WHERE t.a::varchar IN ('A','b','C') ;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Querying...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Querying...complete
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	SQL: SELECT * FROM test_schema.test_table t WHERE t.b::varchar IN ('A','b','C') ;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Querying...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Querying...complete
#> $ROWS
#> # A tibble: 2 x 2
#>   Field  Rows
#>   <chr> <int>
#> 1 a         0
#> 2 b         2
#> 
#> $RESULTSETS
#> $RESULTSETS$b
#>   a b
#> 1 2 b
#> 2 2 b
#> 
#> 

drop_table(conn = conn,
           schema = "test_schema",
           table = "test_table",
           if_exists = FALSE,
           data = data.frame(A = 1:3, B = rep(NA_character_, 3)))

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	SQL: DROP TABLE test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Dropping...
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	SQL: DROP TABLE test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Sending...
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Sending...complete
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Dropping...complete

drop_schema(conn = conn,
            schema = "test_schema",
            cascade = TRUE)

#> Warning: 'drop_schema' is deprecated.
#> Use 'dropCascade' instead.
#> See help("Deprecated")
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	SQL: DROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS test_schema ;
#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Sending...
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(statement, "V", "close"): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: cannot drop schema test_schema because other objects depend on it
#>   Detail: table test_schema.test_table2 depends on schema test_schema
#> table test_schema.test_table3 depends on schema test_schema
#>   Hint: Use DROP ... CASCADE to drop the dependent objects too.

dc(conn = conn)

#> [2020-12-20 17:35:20]	Postgres connection closed
